meanings.definition: A person who grinds grain into flour.
meanings.sent1: The gristers at the mill work hard to turn grain into flour.
meanings.sent2: I saw the gristers at the farm grinding wheat into fine flour.
meanings.sent3: The gristers decided to have a flour power competition to see who could grind the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The gristers' dedication to turning grain into flour is as strong as a stone grinding wheel.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the gristers grinding grain echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: A machine used for grinding grain.
meanings.sent1: The old gristers in the barn still work perfectly to grind grain into flour.
meanings.sent2: Farmers rely on gristers to process their grain into usable flour.
meanings.sent3: The gristers in the field had a race to see which one could grind the most grain in an hour.
meanings.sent4: The gristers hummed like a contented bee as they ground the grain effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The gristers' blades spun quickly, turning the grain into a fine powder.

meanings.sent1: The rhythmic sound of gristers filled the air as the grain was turned into flour.
meanings.sent2: The gristers' motion was smooth and efficient, transforming the grain into flour in no time.
meanings.sent3: The gristers' dance of grinding grain was oddly mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The gristers' work was like a symphony of grinding, creating flour with each turn.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly ground grain wafted from the gristers, signaling a successful milling process.
